    • Method Detail

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Depending on which jframe button and mouse button is clicked, this method will do different stuff.
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
        Parameters:
        e - input from mouse

      • findCorrectButton

        public int[] findCorrectButton(java.lang.Object o)
        Finds the coordinate of a pressed button
        Parameters:
        o - the button that has been pressed
        Returns:
        returns the coordinates of the button in an integer array where the first element is the row-coordinate and the second the column-coordinate

      • openButtons

        public void openButtons(int row,
               int column)
        Opens the button. If it is a mine, the game is lost. If it is empty, it will open all the surrounding empty squares.
        Parameters:
        row - the button's row-coordinate
        column - the button's column-coordinate

      • markWithFlag

        public void markWithFlag(int row,
                int column)
        Marks the button with a flag. A flag means that the player thinks that the button hides a mine.
        Parameters:
        row - button's row coordinate
        column - button's column coordinate

      • countTime

        public int countTime()
        Returns:
        How many seconds that has elapsed from the first opened button until the game stops

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Depending on the input (from the menubar) it will act in three different ways: master--> a new game at master level medio---> a new game at normal level beginner--> a new game at greenhorn level
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - Actionevent
